title: Propulsion Assignment
description: Analyze the fundamental principles of rocket propulsion and calculate thrust, specific impulse, and exhaust velocity for a given engine design.

title: Combustion Analysis
description: Perform a detailed combustion analysis of a bipropellant rocket engine, including stoichiometry, flame temperature, and combustion efficiency calculations.

title: Nozzle Design Project
description: Design and optimize a rocket nozzle using the method of characteristics. Submit CAD drawings and a report detailing your design choices and performance predictions.

title: Aerodynamics Quiz
description: Demonstrate understanding of subsonic and supersonic aerodynamic principles including lift, drag, and boundary layer theory as applied to aerospace vehicles.

title: Flow Analysis
description: Use computational fluid dynamics tools to analyze airflow over a given airfoil geometry. Submit simulation results and a written interpretation of flow behavior.

title: Heating Analysis
description: Evaluate aerodynamic heating effects on a re-entry vehicle traveling at hypersonic speeds. Analyze heat flux distribution and propose thermal protection strategies.

title: Structural Design Task
description: Design a load-bearing spacecraft structural component using appropriate materials and manufacturing techniques. Justify your material selection with stress and fatigue analysis.

title: Orbital Calculations
description: Compute orbital parameters for a spacecraft mission including transfer orbits, delta-v budgets, and launch windows using Kepler's laws and orbital mechanics equations.

title: Systems Engineering Exam
description: Demonstrate knowledge of spacecraft systems engineering processes including requirements definition, interface control, verification and validation, and risk management.

title: Molecular Structure Quiz
description: Identify and draw molecular structures for a set of organic compounds using IUPAC nomenclature. Predict bond angles and hybridization states for each molecule.

title: Reaction Mechanism Analysis
description: Propose step-by-step reaction mechanisms for a series of organic transformations. Identify nucleophiles, electrophiles, and intermediates in each reaction pathway.

title: Functional Group Synthesis Project
description: Design a multi-step synthetic route to a target organic molecule incorporating at least four distinct functional group transformations. Justify your reagent and condition choices.

title: Coordination Complex Problem Set
description: Solve problems involving coordination chemistry including naming complexes, determining oxidation states, predicting geometries, and applying crystal field theory.

title: Symmetry and Point Group Assignment
description: Assign point groups to a set of molecules and use character tables to determine IR and Raman active vibrational modes. Include symmetry element diagrams.

title: Solid State Structure Exam
description: Analyze crystal structures using X-ray diffraction data. Determine unit cell parameters, packing efficiency, and coordination environments for a given inorganic solid.

title: Thermodynamics Problem Set
description: Apply laws of thermodynamics to calculate enthalpy, entropy, and Gibbs free energy changes for a series of chemical reactions and phase transitions.

title: Spectroscopy Analysis
description: Interpret NMR, IR, and mass spectra to determine the structure of unknown compounds. Provide a complete structural elucidation with supporting evidence from each technique.

title: Kinetics Lab Report
description: Write a formal lab report analyzing the kinetics of a chemical reaction. Determine rate law, rate constant, and activation energy from experimental data using graphical methods.

title: Ancient Script Decipherment Exercise
description: Apply linguistic decipherment techniques to analyze a sample of an ancient Middle-earth script. Identify recurring patterns, propose phonetic values, and translate a short passage.

title: Language Evolution Essay
description: Write a scholarly essay tracing the evolution of a Middle-earth language family over time. Discuss phonological shifts, borrowed vocabulary, and the influence of historical events on linguistic change.

title: Manuscript Translation Project
description: Translate a provided excerpt from an ancient Middle-earth manuscript into modern English. Include annotations explaining your translation choices and any ambiguous passages.

title: Spellcasting Theory Exam
description: Demonstrate theoretical knowledge of spellcasting mechanics including incantation structure, magical energy channeling, and the ethical use of spells in various scenarios.

title: Elven Lore Research Paper
description: Research and write an academic paper on a chosen aspect of Elven lore, drawing from primary texts and scholarly commentary. Cite all sources using proper academic formatting.

title: Potion Crafting Practical
description: Document the step-by-step process of crafting a chosen potion, including ingredient sourcing, preparation techniques, and safety precautions. Submit a lab report with your results and observations.
